snippet: The Ukrainian government declared a moratorium Friday on repaying about $3.5 billion in debt to Russia, introducing new strains to an already poisonous relationship.
abstract: Ukraine declares moratorium on repayment of its $3.5 billion debt to Russia, saying that it will not make payments unless Pres Vladimir V Putin's government accepts restructuring program or court orders repayment; Ukrainian officials say repayment of bond in full would violate terms of country's International Monetary Fund bailout of $17.5 billion.
lead_paragraph: The Ukrainian government declared a moratorium Friday on repaying about $3.5 billion in debt to Russia, introducing new strains to an already poisonous relationship.

headline.main: Ukraine Halts Repayments on $3.5 Billion It Owes Russia
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Halts Repayments on Billions It Owes to Russia

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Customs Union of Russia, Belarus and Kazakhstan
